info.title: Capitol clj services (Gofapi).
info.summary: Middleware API for Capitol AI Services
info.description:
The Capitol AI Services API acts as the middleware between users and Capitol's AI-powered services, such as story generation.
                          
                          **Features:**
                          - **User Management:** Create, update, and manage user accounts.
                          - **Session Handling:** Secure authentication and session management.
                          - **AI Content Generation:** Generate dynamic content like stories using AI.

get.description: Returns the current API version.

put.summary: Update user data in the database.
put.description: Updates the authenticated user's data in the database.

get.description: Searches for users based on a query string.
Retrieves a user's information by their unique ID.

delete.description: Deletes a user's profile by their unique ID.

get.description: Checks if a username can be saved in the database.

post.summary: Upload a profile photo
post.description: Allows the user to upload a profile photo.

post.summary: Save user settings
post.description: Saves the user's settings.

get.description: Signs out the current user.
Fetches the QR code for the authenticated user.
Retrieves the details of the currently authenticated user.

post.summary: Authenticate current user with auth code
post.description: Authenticates the current user using an authorization code.

post.summary: Stripe Webhook for Membership Updates
post.description: Handles webhook notifications from Stripe, triggered when a user completes a plan purchase or an event occurs within Stripe. Processes updates to user memberships accordingly.

get.description: Fetches the user's current membership details, including whether they have a free plan or a paid pro plan.
Provides a list of all memberships associated with the user, including current and any historical memberships.
Returns the list of membership plans currently available for purchase, as configured within Stripe.
Called by Stripe upon successful plan purchase, finalizing the membership update for the user in the system.
Generates a new session to initiate the plan purchase process via Stripe.

post.summary: Apply credits to a user's account with a promo code
post.description: Adds credits to the specified user account by validating and applying a promo code.

post.summary: Directly add credits to a user's account
post.description: Manually credits the user's account based on provided user ID and credit amount. Additional notes can be included for record-keeping.

post.summary: Submit user feedback and receive credits
post.description: Saves user feedback and grants credits to the user's account in exchange. This feedback can help improve the story or system performance.

get.summary: Verify if the story has been rated by its author
get.description: Checks whether the author has already rated their story with a thumbs up or thumbs down.

post.summary: Record thumbs up/down feedback for a story
post.description: Saves a thumbs up or down rating for a story, indicating whether the author liked or disliked it.

post.summary: Create a WebSocket address for PDF and URL processing
post.description: Generates a WebSocket (WS) address for processing user-uploaded PDFs and URLs, enabling real-time communication for source processing.

post.summary: Upload and process user sources asynchronously
post.description: Accepts and processes user-provided sources (PDFs, URLs, etc.) asynchronously. Files are temporarily stored for 1 hour during processing. Returns a WebSocket URL for real-time processing status updates.

post.summary: Process JSON user sources
post.description: Processes user-provided source data in JSON format, including source IDs, filenames, and data details, for seamless synchronization.

post.summary: Process files user's sources synchronously
post.description: Processes user-provided source data in PDF or Image format, including source IDs, filenames, and data details, for seamless synchronization.

get.description: Fetches all sources associated with a specified story, identified by story ID, for streamlined access to related content.

post.summary: Validate YouTube link
post.description: Checks if a given YouTube link is valid and can be processed, verifying compatibility for source integration.

get.summary: Retrieve all story configurations for the user
get.description: Fetches a list of all story configurations saved by the user. These configurations determine settings such as length and style for story creation.

post.summary: Create a new story configuration
post.description: Generates a new story configuration with optional fields such as description, configuration name, and display name. The storyplan structure allows custom settings for the story.

put.description: Updates an existing user story configuration by ID, with options to modify the configuration name, display name, and storyplan details.

delete.description: Removes a story configuration from the user's account, identified by configuration ID.

get.description: Retrieves the list of available story plan schemas that define customizable options, such as length, tone, and audience, for story creation.

post.summary: Generate title and description with AI
post.description: Uses an AI model to generate a suggested title and description based on provided settings, including audience, creativity level, and reading level.

get.description: Fetches the default story configuration set by the user for streamlined story creation.

post.summary: Set a default story configuration for the user
post.description: Allows the user to set a specific story configuration as the default for future story creation.

post.summary: Create or update a story configuration by name
post.description: Creates a new story configuration or updates an existing one, using the provided configuration name to identify it.

post.summary: Fake upload sources

get.description: Fetches the details of a story based on either share ID or story ID, with an optional parameter for unfurling.

post.summary: Save a new story
post.description: Creates and saves a new story in the database with the provided content.

put.description: Updates a story in the database with modified details and an option to regenerate the unfurl.

delete.description: Removes a story from the database, identified by its ID.

get.description: Returns minimal information for a story, including ID and migration status, for lightweight requests.

post.summary: Remix a complete story
post.description: Creates a new version of a story by remixing it with optional user-defined configurations and a specified plan.

get.description: Retrieves the sequence of events for a particular story, identified by story ID.

post.summary: Fork an existing story
post.description: Creates an independent copy of an existing story that can be modified and expanded upon by the user, regardless of whether they are the original author. The forked story is detached from the original `author_id`, allowing full editing freedom without affecting the original story.

get.description: Retrieves a list of stories associated with a specified user, with options for pagination, sorting, and filtering.

patch.description: Updates the visibility status of a story, allowing it to be made public or private based on the user's preference.

get.summary: Retrieve generated prompts for the homepage
get.description: Fetches a curated list of prompts generated by our LLM to display on the homepage. These prompts provide users with suggestions and ideas to help them get started.
Fetches a preview link for a chart generated by Tako, an external chart generation service. This link provides a visual preview of the requested chart based on the specified parameters.
Fetches a preview link for a chart generated by Tako using version 2 of the API. This was created as a POC of capitol versioning.
Generates the OAuth URI to begin the authentication process with Twitter, allowing users to authorize the app.

post.summary: Handle Twitter OAuth callback
post.description: Processes the callback from Twitter OAuth after the user has authorized the app. Requires the OAuth token and verifier to complete the authentication.

post.summary: Post a tweet with media
post.description: Publishes a tweet containing media, such as images. Requires tweet text and media content for successful posting.

post.summary: Submit Google Drive authorization code for the current user
post.description: Sends the users authorization code to Google Drive to establish access. This step is required to enable exporting stories to Google Drive.

get.summary: Retrieve Google Drive accounts authorized by the user
get.description: Fetches a list of Google Drive accounts that the user has authorized, allowing verification of linked accounts.

delete.summary: Remove Google Drive authorizations for the user
delete.description: Deletes all Google Drive account authorizations for the user, revoking access for exporting stories.

post.summary: Export a story to Google Drive
post.description: Takes a story ID and exports the corresponding story to the users Google Drive account. Requires prior authorization from the user to access Google Drive.

get.summary: Retrieve a Capitol project by user
get.description: Fetches a specific Capitol project using the project ID. A project contains various documents and sources uploaded or created by the user.

post.summary: Create a new Capitol project
post.description: Creates a new Capitol project where users can add sources (PDFs, images, URLs) and documents.

put.description: Updates a Capitol project with new or existing details, including its name and sources (PDFs, images, URLs).

delete.description: Deletes a specified Capitol project from the user's account based on the project ID.

get.summary: List all Capitol projects for a user
get.description: Retrieves a list of all Capitol projects associated with the user, optionally including sources and allowing pagination through limit and offset parameters.

get.summary: List all Capitol documents within a project
get.description: Fetches all documents under a specified project ID, displaying all documents associated with the project.

get.summary: Retrieve Capitol documents within a specific project
get.description: Retrieves documents within a given project, with optional pagination using offset. Allows specifying a project ID.

put.description: Transfers a document from one project to another, specified by document ID, origin project ID, and target project ID.

delete.summary: Remove a document from a project
delete.description: Deletes a specified document from a project based on document ID.

get.description: Fetches all sources (PDFs, images, URLs) used in the documents of a specified project.

put.summary: Copy a source to another project
put.description: Copies a source (PDF, image, or URL) from one project to another, specified by origin project ID, target project ID, and source type.

delete.summary: Delete a source from a project
delete.description: Removes a specific source from a project, based on project ID, source ID, and source type.

get.summary: Retrieve Capitol events for a specific document
get.description: Fetches a list of events associated with a specific document (or story) by story-id. A document consists of multiple events, and may have several versions or iterations called drafts. Events can be modified individually or at the document level if changes are made across drafts.

delete.description: Removes a particular event from a document draft, using the event-id and story-id to identify the specific event to delete.

patch.summary: Execute a bulk update of events within a document draft
patch.description: Performs a bulk update across multiple events within a specified draft of a document, identified by draft depth. This operation can include modifying event content, adjusting draft-specific parameters, and adding or removing events. Events to delete can also be specified in the request.

post.summary: Transform an event block into a different block type
post.description: Modifies the type of an event block within a document, allowing any block type to be converted into another (e.g., from image to text or vice versa). This endpoint accepts parameters for customizing output type, subtype, and optionally specifying the draft and position within the document structure.

get.summary: Retrieve chat history for a story or component
get.description: Retrieve the complete chat history for a specific story or a component within a story. To access the entire story-level chat, omit the component-id parameter in the request.

post.summary: Submit a user message and receive an agents response
post.description: Sends a new user message to the chat and returns an automated response from the agent.

post.summary: Reset chat history for a specific block
post.description: Notifies the backend to reset the chat history for a designated block based on recent user actions.

post.summary: Initiate document generation and obtain streaming address
post.description: Initiates the document generation process and returns a WebSocket address for streaming events, including segments of AI-generated content. The request body may include a 'story plan'an object containing customization instructions such as length, model selection, use of images or charts, and more. You must provide either a story plan or a story plan ID

post.summary: Request prompt suggestions for a content block
post.description: Generates a list of suggested prompts for modifying a specific content block, such as making a text block longer or more detailed.

post.summary: Stop the ongoing story generation
post.description: Stops the story generation process based on the provided story-id parameter.

get.description: Provides a report on recently registered users, including relevant user metrics for tracking growth and engagement.

get.summary: Generate report on users accepting marketing emails
get.description: Returns a report of all users who have opted into and received marketing emails, tracking engagement for marketing initiatives.

get.summary: Generate report on new story creation
get.description: Fetches a report summarizing new stories created by users over a given period, useful for tracking content generation trends.
Provides metrics on user sign-ups, offering insights into user acquisition rates and platform growth.
